title: President to visit India in mid-December: Foreign Minister
byline: Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said yesterday that President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is set to visit India in mid-December for his maiden state visit.

title: President urges IMF to maintain balanced approach in economic recovery programme
byline: While highlighting his government’s commitment to addressing the pressing needs of the people, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake urged the IMF to maintain a balanced approach that considers the hardships faced by citizens.

title: President retains Defence, Finance and Digital Economy Ministries
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has retained the Ministries of Defence, Finance and Economic Development and the Digital Economy.

title: Bimal appointed Leader of the House, Nalinda Chief Government Whip
byline: Minister Bimal Rathnayake has been appointed as the Leader of the House while Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa  has been appointed as Chief Government Whip, the Government said.

title: New Public Security Minister vows to end police politicisation
byline: While assuring the public that tackling bribery and corruption will remain a priority, the new Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijayapala said today that he is committed to restoring the independence of the Sri Lanka Police, which he noted had been politicised under previous governments.

title: Train derailed at Diyatalawa
byline: A train traveling from Kandy to Badulla derailed at the Diyatalawa railway station a short while ago, the Railways Department said.

title: Nalinda Jayatissa appointed as Cabinet Media Spokesman
byline: Minister of Health and Mass Media Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has been appointed as the Cabinet Spokesman for the new government.

title: Kanchana Wijesekara to enter Parliament through National List?
byline: Former Minister and New Democratic Front (NDF) candidate Kanchana Wijesekara is likely to enter Parliament through the National List, a number of former MPs told the media a shortwhile ago.

title: Over 100 mm rains likely today
byline: Heavy rains above 100 mm are likely today in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and Northern Provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts, the Meteorology Department sai

title: Security tightened at Ravi K’s residence over National List seat
byline: Security was increased this morning outside the official residence of former Finance Minister Ravi Karunanayake in Battaramulla, anticipating protests over the gazetting of his name for one of the two National List seats.

title: Court orders medical report on Lohan Ratwatte’s health condition
byline: The Court of Appeal today issued an order directing the hospital authorities to submit a report on the health condition of former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte, who is currently in remand custody in connection with a case involving an unregistered luxury vehicle.

title: Sri Lanka names squad for upcoming Test series against South Africa
byline: The Sri Lanka Cricket Selection Committee has named a 17-player squad for the two-match Test series against South Africa.

title: New Zealand: Thousands protest in Wellington over Māori bill
byline: Tens of thousands of New Zealanders rallied in front of parliament on Tuesday in one of the country’s largest ever protests to oppose a bill, which opponents say seeks to dilute the rights of Maori and threatens to set race relations back decades.

title: UNP disputes Ravi’s nomination for National List slot, EC gazettes Ravi’s name
byline: The United National Party (UNP) disassociated itself from the nomination of its member former MP Ravi Karunanayake on the National List to Parliament and vowed to institute disciplinary action against him.

title: No more state ministers, 26-28 deputy ministers to be appointed soon
byline: In a departure from the practice of the previous rules, the new government has decided to scrap the concept of state ministers but will proceed with the appointment of 26-28 deputy ministers instead within a day or two, a minister said yesterday.

title: ADB approves USD 200 million policy-based loan to Sri Lanka
byline: Manila, Philiphines (19 November 2024) — The Asian Development Bank (ADB) today approved a USD 200 million policy-based loan to further help the Government of Sri Lanka strengthen its financial sector, the Asian Development Bank (ADB)said.

title: Challenging arrest over road accident in 2023: Ravi Seneviratne’s FR dismissed
byline: A Fundamental Rights petition filed by incumbent Public Security Ministry Secretary Ravi Seneviratne challenging his arrest over a road accident in 2023 has been dismissed by Supreme Court.

title: Ranjith Madduma Bandara named as one of SJB national list MPs
byline: An Extraordinary Gazette has officially named Ranjith Madduma Bandara as a National List Member of Parliament (MP) representing the Samagi Jana Balavegaya (SJB).

title: 18 Ministry Secretaries appointed
byline: New Secretary to the Prime Minister, the Cabinet Secretary and 16 Ministry Secretaries were appointed today, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Government seeks to remove barriers to effective public service
byline: The government aims to create an environment where public officials can serve freely and effectively while removing barriers that hinder both officials and citizens in delivering and accessing services.

title: Conducting A/L tuition classes prohibited from tonight
byline: Conducting coaching or tuition classes targeting the 2024 GCE Advanced Level (A/L) Examinations will be prohibited from midnight today, the Department of Examinations said.

title: Aruni Ranaraja appointed new Foreign Secretary
byline: Aruni Ranaraja has been appointed as the new Foreign Secretary, succeeding Aruni Wijewardena, who previously held the position.

title: Meningococcal disease outbreak at Army Training School under control
byline: The outbreak of Meningococcal disease at the Sri Lanka Army Recruit Training School in Vedditalativu is under control, Director of the National Institute of Infectious Diseases (NIID) said.
